div.p: The optional attribute ISSUE denotes the specific type of issue described in BIOGRAPHY HEALTH . Its attribute values will allow us to separate health issues pertaining to PHYSICAL and MENTAL health and to specifically FEMALEBODY health concerns. We are interested in facilitating research into the gendered nature of women's relation to the medical institution, female illnesses such as breast cancer, and women's oppression by mental health institutions, to name only a few. If you judge that two different issues are involved, open two successive HEALTH tags with different attributions.

div.codeblock: Shortly after 1953, SP had a breakdown and attempted suicide.
<HEALTH ISSUE="femalebody"><CHRONSTRUCT><DATE>1850</DATE> <CHRONPROSE>AAB discovered that she had cancer of the uterus.</CHRONPROSE></CHRONSTRUCT></HEALTH>

div.p: To the best of your ability, try to include separate DIV1 elements when you have separate health issues. This will allow you to assign the appropriate issue attribute value to the information. But if the health issues discussed overlap, then leave the attribute blank.
Question: The woman writer I am researching suffered from health problems for the last years of her life but there is no information about what kind of health problems. What attribute do I give this?
Answer: If unknown, leave attribute blank.
Question: The woman writer I am researching suffered a fall that led to her lifelong depression. Is this mental or physical?

Answer: Either leave the attribute blank, or open two successive HEALTH elements and apply and PHYSICAL to the first and MENTAL to the second. This will mean two scrappy sentences, but lifelong depression sounds worth an attribute and a few details.
